info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 11 at 3:20PM CST until January 12 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... .A cold front will move across South Texas tonight into Friday morning. The combination of a strong to very strong northwesterly flow and low relative humidity values expected behind it will result in Critical fire weather conditions across South Texas from late tonight through Friday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 3 PM CST FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Red Flag Warning for VERY STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from 2 AM to 3 PM CST Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...Kleberg Islands. * TIMING... * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 30 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 66. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong to very strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
